body: @vongosling It follows the standard streamer integration for Ignite. The docs on how to use will be available on https://apacheignite-mix.readme.io/docs.
Unnecessary commits are in this pull request. closing.
Created by mistake, base branch should be not master
Created by mistake, base branch should be not master

Fixed:
1. Thread pool isn't shutdown in case of Exception in some cases.
2. Unresolved ClusterNode addresses cause NPE while node address being checked for reachability.

System.getProperty("sun.arch.data.model") may return null on non hotspot VM. I suggest to flip equals as 
"32".equals(System.getProperty("sun.arch.data.model"))

I also think you should catch the IllegalArgumentException and make a suggestion to a user to check the JVM, because it may be running on a different VM (sun.arch.data.model may return null, as Dmitriy suggested)
Replaced with https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/1980 : new base: master and new branch name: ignite-4947 were used
Replaced with https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/1986 PR with all-in-one commit

Hello Roman,

Thanks for your contribution, it looks fine for me with one minor comment: I believe that test `GridCacheLocalAtomicMetricsSelfTest` duplicates existing `GridCacheAtomicLocalMetricsSelfTest`. Configurations provided by both test classes are completely the same.

Please remove unnecessary test.

The mechanism is similar to invalidate() of the WebSessionV2 class. The {@link #invalidate()} action will be delegated to the genuine session. Similarly, actions setAttribute(), removeAttribute(), and setMaxInactiveInterval() should be delegated to the genuine session. This way, the web container can do to the session whatever it promises to do, such as calling the HttpSessionBindingListener's valueUnbound callback function, etc.

Sorry, I was away. 

I have looked at this PR a bit more closely. The patch is good, but there some need to fix the commit message. It has to start with `IGNITE-5332` (note the capital letters).
The synopsis of the commit should match the JIRA name exactly as well as the title of the PR. This allows Apache jira bot to pick up the changes in the PR and populate them into the JIRA ticket. JIRA is (still) the main source of truth for all Apache projects. 
For more info, check this page https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IGNITE/How+to+Contribute#HowtoContribute-1.CreateGitHubpull-request and search for `To make contribution` section.

Looking forward for your fixes. Thank you!
@c0s thanks for your feedback and sorry for the inconvenience. I've updated pull request by changing commit message.
Thanks! Could you please change the name of the PR so it gets associated with the JIRA ticket?
This ticket was implemented in master during implementation of  IGNITE-5473 (commit cf345b81820fbbcb82e5fcb2283b43ea286a40b4) so I'm closing this PR.

This looks all right actually.

Could you please arrange a quick run of the tests on this fix on the official Ignite TeamCity server (http://ci.ignite.apache.org/queue.html)? Please be specifically aware about "http" protocol - the server isn't secured and if you're using anything like HTTPSEverywhere (as you should, of course) you won't be able to use the CI at all ;(

Of course, here are test results: http://ci.ignite.apache.org/viewType.html?buildTypeId=IgniteTests_IgniteBasic&branch_IgniteTests=pull%2F2321%2Fhead&tab=buildTypeStatusDiv
New failed test does not seem connected to my changes.

Ah, great, I've missed it, I guess.
+1 for the fix. Will commit this by the end of the day!
Hi @c0s . Just a reminder about this pull request. Thanks in advance.
The patch has been committed to the Ignite's master yesterday. The JIRA is resolved. You need to close your PR. Thanks for the contribution!
Register expired and removed event listeners with the WebSession cache or the binary cache, in order to invoke them when a session expires or a session attribute gets removed, etc.

Hi,
I'm facing this issue to, but in a slightly different scenario. 

However I wonder how `schemaIds` can be null since BinaryMetadata constructor sets this field to `Collections.emptySet();` in a "worst" case.

Unless the `BinaryMetadata` is also deserialized and its constructor is not called.
